website_summaries.verdict: This cart, with a 330 pound maximum weight limit, "walks" over steps thanks to its three-wheel construction.
pros: Handle height is adjustable to maximize comfort and efficiency
cons: It's "light duty" compared to some industrial offerings
check weight limit of any hand truck you buy to make sure it fits your needs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It was amazing, We used it to bring a large wooden Wishing Well up some stairs and it rolled up the stairs without damaging the edges of the stairs. I bought for my son for his musical equipment at school for all the stairs he has to climb, but after I saw how well it works, I think I will get one just to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect time! Rolls smoothly up and down the stairs. I read reviews and laughed instantly when I opened the box. People complaining about no assembly instructions. I attached pictures of how it comes out of the box.....If you need instructions to slide the wheels on and tighten nuts I would question your ability to even use this....Just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 2 use with only 60lbs
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised to hold 330lbs. It broke on the second use with a 60 lb pony keg! The seller now wants me to fix it locally. Do not buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This product is durable and well constructed. It is a lifesaver for those who suffer from arthritis or any debilitating condition which limits heavy lifting or range of motion.
customer_reviews.author: jmamazon

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Pleasantly surprised at how sturdy it is. Had to put some padding in certain areas just to protect my hardwood floors. If you are careful you probably would not damage your floors but, better safe than sorry. Like the fact that it folds down for easy storage. Over all, a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: T Davis

customer_reviews.title: A nice heavy duty cart
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought a cheap cart like this on HSN and it is a piece of junk! But the usefulness of having a cart like this for a 68 year old man or woman to bring all of our purchase left o the porch by UPS or FedEx or the mail peopleis a back saver! It seems to be very sturdy and even comes with a nice long bunjee cord. You won't regret getting this cart!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it can harm floors
customer_reviews.text: Amazon's shipping box was in good shape, but the manufacturer's box inside looked like it had been man-handled by a much annoyed gorilla. The product itself was generally unharmed, despite having just been stuffed into the slightly too small box with no padding. This cart will get heavy boxes up and down stairs, but it's a slow process. The deal breaker for me is that one set of feet has no protection, and the sharp, exposed metal will definitely harm your floor. I immediately returned this item, not waiting to measure the half life the horrendous stench when the cart is first unboxed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hunter

customer_reviews.title: It will damage your floors
customer_reviews.text: While it is lighter in weight than a typical dolly, I don't find it any easier to use. My biggest problem is that the two "feet" that contact the floor have no protection and have damaged my brand new floors.
customer_reviews.author: kerriberri81

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart. It navigates stairs well
customer_reviews.text: Nice cart. It navigates stairs well. The wheels are heavy duty and it has back legs to rest the cart level. Comes with a bungle strap that's made kinda weird. Have not used it yet but seems heavy duty enough to do most kobs
customer_reviews.author: Eugene P. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery;easy to assemble and it rolls up and down the stairs. However, I have not tried it loaded as yet. Will follow up. Just tried it. Carried 45 pounds up 18 stairs with a breeze. I used to physically carry that load up periodically (cat litter)now I can use the cart!
customer_reviews.author: garded

customer_reviews.title: This climber has been an invaluable help especially when we ...
customer_reviews.text: This climber has been an invaluable help especially when we moved this past summer. One can imagine how heavy boxes of books can be going up and down stairs. This thing was a trooper! Because of it's heavy duty construction, I didn't have to worry about damaging it or having it fall apart when taking a heavy box up/down the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cordice

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for transferring items up and down the basement steps
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for transferring items up and down the basement steps. Absolutely the best item I purchased for this purpose. Definitely no problem. Very strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box as soon as it arrived and started using it. I am gutting my master bath and hauling the sheet rock, tub, sinks and misc. debris down 2 stories. It works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What are its true specifications ?
customer_reviews.text: Received the 330 lb capacity product. Assembled it. The actual size of this step dolly appears smaller than the photo. The specifications on Amazon page says that the width is 18". I cannot figure out where is this measurement taken. I can only measure the width of the frame to 12" X 13.5". I hope I was not shipped a lighter model. Also the "T" bar that opens up perpendicular to the dolly is slightly skewed. It not straight. Does not seem to be sturdy. When I rest the dolly the "T" bar, it just bends on its hinge. Does not support even the weight of an empty Keyboard soft-case.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep Saxena

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built cart, steel construction, strong wheels. ...
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built cart, steel construction, strong wheels. Haul 40 pound bags of kitty litter up stairs, hauled a 32" analog TV down stairs. Haul in crates of bottled water. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: California

customer_reviews.title: Garbage company with ZERO support, no instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all so far. Unit did NOT come with any sort of assembly instructions (and assembly is not straight forward like you may think). I called AND emailed Vevor which claimed to have 24*6 support (limited Sunday hours) and NO ONE bothered to pick the phone up and I haven't heard back from email either. Obviously a JOKE of a company that cares less about customers. I recommend trying to find a USA-based company for a better quality unit than this one.
customer_reviews.author: H. Templeman

customer_reviews.title: using it to move refers, tubs, toilets etc ...
customer_reviews.text: using it to move refers, tubs, toilets etc up and down 100's of stairs and this cart makes it so much easier. i would suggest anyone needing relief from the bumping of stairs to buy one...i bought two
customer_reviews.author: ct

customer_reviews.title: Serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy & handy gadget. We needed it to take luggage in & out of a second floor condo. It works perfectly! Had an issue With a wheel bearing that was missing but found the replacement piece on Amazon & seller reimbursed us with no issue for the cost. Easy fix. Worth every penny. Really works surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.author: GRANDMA

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy, and dangerous to use
customer_reviews.text: The hand truck broke while moving a 60ld item. It's flimsy and not worth the money. I want a refund as it's also dangerous and does not cart up small staircases as advertised. The support rack that holds the load and bent and broke moving a 60ld item
customer_reviews.author: Vsmith

customer_reviews.title: I love this cart for the stair climbing
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart for the stair climbing. But it is very ackward in door ways with a wider load. Plus it is unstable with a longer load as well. I will figure a way to use this cart for my massage table.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart!
customer_reviews.text: Great Cart! Very well made and has been extremely helpful in getting our groceries up the stairs and in the door. Worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Romero

customer_reviews.title: I ise this all the time and for everything! ...
customer_reviews.text: I ise this all the time and for everything!. Ived moved dressers, groceries, TV stands, water cases, literally everything heavy and its worked wonders for me amd my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Overrated for weight, botttom frame bent when attempting to move a 130 pound Air Conditioner.
customer_reviews.text: Rated for 300 pounds, but bottom tray bent when I put a 130 pound Air Conditioner on it. Works great for light loads, less than 70 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Neis

customer_reviews.title: Great for stairs!
customer_reviews.text: This is lightweight and easy to maneuver. It worked really well for going up and down the stairs with heavy items! Less items for me to carry during my move; I loved it! Only thing that would make it better is to have the platform part flat to the ground so that it can be slid under the items without having to first lift them to get onto the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha F.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed ok at first
customer_reviews.text: Bent under the slightest amount of pressure going upstairs to point where the loading piece wouldn’t move
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the ease of transporting heavy objects such as a case of beer or water up stairs or both at the same time. I found the stand to be very annoying as it kept getting in the way until I fastened to the frame with a small bungee cord.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Rowe

customer_reviews.title: The product works well, but the handle came assembled ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, but the handle came assembled incorrectly which caused me to initially smash my fingers before correcting it.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Cart
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, met expectation! Longer bottom plate to hold larger packages more securely. Moves up and down stairs easily. Would recommend for light to medium loads, up to 40lbs. Will handle heavier loads with one person pulling and another helping by grabbing the end of the bottom plate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think it's kind of heavy for a woman to pull up the stairs and I'm a strong woman you put a 50 lb bag of salt on top of it it really is heavy but I think I'll keep it and use it for different things in my garage moving things around and for the odd step project but again I think it's quite heavy structurally and that makes it quite heavy to maneuver with a heavy object on top of it a man probably could handle it very easily.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. I think it's kind of heavy for a woman to pull up the stairs and I'm a strong woman you put a 50 lb bag of salt on top of it it really is heavy but I think I'll keep it and use it for different things in my garage moving things around and for the odd step project but again I think it's quite heavy structurally and that makes it quite heavy to maneuver with a heavy object on top of it a man probably could handle it very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great with my two story move. Would not of been as easy without it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very little assembly required. Used primarily for moving 18 gallon storage bins up and down stairs. Rolls easily over carpeted stairs (closed back stairs). Bins usually in the 30 to 50 pound range. I would wonder about the unit handling anything in the claimed 300 pound range - I do not think it would work. But gain, for weights under 100# it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: NW Illinois Guy

customer_reviews.title: This is great. Just moved into new house this is a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Just moved into new house this is a life saver for my back. Works great on stairs
customer_reviews.author: George N

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps mine was incomplete - but the back resting arm ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps mine was incomplete - but the back resting arm does ot stay open, the bottom bends right up so I can't put tray under items I want to carry, and this arrived with no instructions. As received, this cart is worthless and unusable.
customer_reviews.author: N. Denker

customer_reviews.title: Oh-wee-oh!
customer_reviews.text: We just moved into a house with NINETEEN steps to the main floor! Without this clever device we would end up leaving everything in the garage! We have two of these devices; this one and another that has a roomy bag attached. We find both extremely useful. The triple wheel allows continued contact with the stair as it moves from step to step so nothing gets stuck. The VEVOR cart is much more heavy duty than the others and my son has lashed some very large items to this, dragging nearly a hundred pounds up the stairs. If this breaks down, we will simply order another.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stair riser to work better
customer_reviews.text: It helped a lot, but on narrow steps it is a breeze to use, BUT on the stairs I needed the stair-climber, the stair's risers we're open and the wheels just fit in the opening. But everywhere else the climber worked great. Maybe if the wheels were larger in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: It works well still strong
customer_reviews.text: It works great for the stairs. Still putting it to work each day. Still holding up. Only thing I would change is some how make it turn easier if that is possible. It works!! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F.

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: Put 150 lbs on cart & took down 3 stairs very hard & difficult to handle, Got down 3 stairs and lifted handle 3 inches the cart flipped & pulled me down the stairs. I am now laid up for 8 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Loaded up the Christmas decorations from the basement and back and this certainly did the job. Used it to help a neighbor move his AC unit and again it did the job. Makes life a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: A. Okura

customer_reviews.title: Very useful & helpful
customer_reviews.text: I believe that anybody living at the apartment or condo with stairs should have one. Very useful & helpful. I have tried several different types and found it's one of the best. To carry the items, I put a small box /container on the cart and put the items in there and bind them with bungee Cord Hook.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Made my life easier. Now I can haul planters ...
customer_reviews.text: Made my life easier. Now I can haul planters in and outdoors without wrecking my back or needing help.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie2020

customer_reviews.title: It handles a lot of equipment
customer_reviews.text: It’s very smooth to pull and really climbs stairs and curbs. I use it for my work with the school system
customer_reviews.author: Melony Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needs to be addressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 months ago 1 of the 6 wheels broke at the bearing All the wheels look like they were never lined up The handle will not collapse anymore. Personally I think it was used and then returned to seller. Not sure what the warranty is. I hope it’s more then 3 months Concerned Amazon Prime customer
customer_reviews.author: momwith2boys

customer_reviews.title: The company is solid and stand behind their product
customer_reviews.text: I like this cart because it appears to be solid and well built with a 330lbs WGT rating I love this cart, just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Highlanderone

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: My item arrived damaged. The box had holes punched it in so that the cart would fit. One of the inside parts of one of the wheel-sets was missing and the other loose. I requested a replacement wheel, but I was given $30 and told to fix it on my own. Since the new part was a different size my cart is now tilted and uneven. It did what I needed it to do though. I am a 61-year-old 5 foot 2 inch woman and I was able, with great difficultly, to get a 70 lb air condition up some pretty steep stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Lois B.

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this. I placed about 30lbs on it and went to take it down the 3 flights of steps and ended up falling down the after the first step because the hand truck was hard to manuver and the wheels did not turn the way they were supposed to and sent me and the hand truck tumbling down the steps together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stair Climber
customer_reviews.text: We will be using this for bringing my Christmas decorations upstairs, really sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: trudy dolnacko

customer_reviews.title: This thing is terrible. Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. Flimsy, wobbly, if you put 330 pounds of something you care about on it you are a fool. Being returned. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Rocheleau

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Missing washers, nuts(got 2) and whatever blue part shown in the assembly photo. Bad choice, and it's crunch time for moving. :(
customer_reviews.author: Dave Siedlyk

customer_reviews.title: Well built, sturdy and solid.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Makes walking up or down with heavy items a breeze. Now we can take our coolers down to boat dock with out straining our backs. O and delvery was fast .
customer_reviews.author: MIXUPAGAIN

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, bit the feet broke off after only a few uses. This leaves a very sharp piece of metal that can scratch floors and cut you if you're not careful. I rated it a 2 for this reason
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wernersbach

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This makes getting cat litter and salt bags down stairs a cinch. The only problem we have had is that the little rubber ends fall off and we have to put back on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product, I love it
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product, I love it, I use it at work to carry huge bags of laundry up and down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Purma

customer_reviews.title: One product you must have if you are moving around the stairs.
customer_reviews.text: Vevor Stair climbing cart was useful for me shifting huge boxes from third floor of my apartment. I would recommend this product for anyone who would have the need to push some extra heavy stuff around. Vevor's responsive customer care is another added protection just in case if you had any issues with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Goutham

customer_reviews.title: Innovative
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I added caps on the 2 square tube ends to prevent floor scratching when folded and stored upright.
customer_reviews.author: Ceilmeade

customer_reviews.title: It does it thing
customer_reviews.text: Do the job okay enough; however, craftsmanship is less than desirable. Just like many comments before mine. You need to sure every bolts are tighten properly before first use.
customer_reviews.author: I_HATE_THIS

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for heavy stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is great for hauling a bunch of small boxes at one time or a few some-what heavy things. Definitely not on a fridge or washer like we bought for originally
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Works for moderate work.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for one person move down 40 steps. I stacked and strapped 2 - 4 gallon containers and many loads later I'm almost done. 100lbs not problem but I wouldn't do anything heavier.
customer_reviews.author: BKV

customer_reviews.title: This one is better than the lighter models.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for climbing stairs. Wife uses it all the time I'm not home to bring heavy things up from basement
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Zacharczuk

customer_reviews.title: My son with his wife and baby are moving from ...
customer_reviews.text: My son with his wife and baby are moving from one house to a bigger one. Both homes have a lot of steps. This dolly has really helped
customer_reviews.author: PAE

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and solid. Keep in mind that its ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and solid. Keep in mind that its a bit heavy but solidly built to last. Some minor assembly required.
customer_reviews.author: Erik T Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It is heavier than I anticipated but ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It is heavier than I anticipated but it works well. There were no instructions on putting the wheels on in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to assemble and arrived earlier than anticipated! Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big help with moving items upstairs.
customer_reviews.text: I have moved many items upstairs and this is a quality tool if you need help moving items.
customer_reviews.author: tomw

customer_reviews.title: Item was scratched up and used!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk and the box had a hole in it when it was delivered. The item was all scratched up like it has been used several time. Hardware was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Lynna Kamura

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it could be a little bit sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction of the axel
customer_reviews.text: It was poorly welded and the axel separated from the main frame during shipping...makes you think that if it had any weight during use the weld would have given way and caused damage!
customer_reviews.author: susan santanastaso

customer_reviews.title: Great without help
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get things upstairs. Got a large chair up by myself. Had to use my strap but I was impressed by how easy the wheels climbed. Shipping was quick and painless DM
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L Marcy

customer_reviews.title: well bilt
customer_reviews.text: the finishing is not good, the ball bearing quality is no good, the design is good, well balanced
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: It not working for me
customer_reviews.text: I live on the 3rd floor and it is much harder to bring up my grocery boxes with this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Y. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for anything under 40 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and poorly constructed. Good for anything under 40 lbs. Smaller than I thought it would be and the smelly rubber tires make the whole house stink. DO NOT BUY THIS FOR HEAVY/BULKY OBJECTS.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mulvey

customer_reviews.title: good unit
customer_reviews.text: We deliver chair lifts into people's homes so this dolly works well.
customer_reviews.author: Medi-Source

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Would like to see wider tires for better use on lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Donald St. John

customer_reviews.title: Climbs Stairs But....
customer_reviews.text: Climbs stairs well, but handle grip us towards load. So it is difficult to lift large objects.
customer_reviews.author: Sumit Verma

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It at least works on a flat floor. Haven't tried it yet on the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: William Davis

customer_reviews.title: Sorry it is not heavy duty but works on lighter items
customer_reviews.text: Works okay Not heavy duty compared to most two wheel dollys More like a toy and not for professional movers Okay for boxes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use and finish part is too lough so might be get a injury finger cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good idea
customer_reviews.text: This makes me a one person mover when using a 1" ratcheting strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The stair climbing functionality
customer_reviews.text: The stair climbing design doesn't function as expected with only 3 cases of water.
customer_reviews.author: Raimundo M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly cart was used to move my son from ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly cart was used to move my son from college dorm down 4 flights of stairs with fairly heavy items worked like a charm. Highly recommend this item!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built and easy to fold away and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a female over 60. This cart enables me to carry a very heavy upstairs to my second floor. I purchased VEVOR Stair Climbing Cart due to the amount of weight it will hold, 450#. Sturdy, well built and easy to fold away and store. I would recommend this products to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: feels like it's going to break
customer_reviews.text: A little thin, can't overload over 200 lbs. feels like it's going to break.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Just I would recommend getting a larger replacement bungee cord to secure the ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually lives up to it's claim so far. The most that I've moved with it so far is is about 180 lbs! Just I would recommend getting a larger replacement bungee cord to secure the load that you are trying to move. I've currently replaced mine with a 6 ft, (72 inch), bungee cord!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: When deciding on load, remain aware unit alone weighs about 8 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: So great for 14 interior steps pre- and post-surgery. Rubber wheels to protect hardwood stairs. Shelf on bottom wide enough to take a clothes basket. Wheels are off-set enough not to restrict load width.
customer_reviews.author: Ragdoll

customer_reviews.title: So happy we bought this product
customer_reviews.text: The Vevor Stair Climbing Cart surpassed our expectations. We've used it several times since our purchase and it has made our life easier. Groceries, bottled water, fall decorations are no longer a problem. So happy we bought this product.Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike Magno

customer_reviews.title: Good, but one problem.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. Only one problem: the bottom plate is too thick. We can't insert the plate under the boxes to set on the hand track. Would be 5 stars if they have an option of a flat bottom plate.
customer_reviews.author: NYer

customer_reviews.title: The hand truck is very sturdy and folds away nicely
customer_reviews.text: The hand truck is very sturdy and folds away nicely. The only issue I had is then there is a large box on the truck, there is no comfortable way to hold onto the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Expected something much better according to the price. The wheels get stuck, and the bolts that fix them came rusty. The bearings are of very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marsh Cavaleiro

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Junk
customer_reviews.text: Item broke with only 320 lbs on it. This would have maimed or killed someone had this broken while climbing stairs. Not to mention all the damage to my stairs, walls, and floor. Take a long hard look at those pictures before you think about transporting a refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble trying pull up the height adjustable handle. Otherwise everything else is fine, I just find it a little heavy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: What I didn't like was that you couldn't scoop under something like you ...
customer_reviews.text: The going up and down works as advertised. What I didn't like was that you couldn't scoop under something like you could with a simple two wheeler, and the posts that set on the floor had cheap plastic inserts that broke off very quickly with use. This then cause the device to rest on open end of the square metal, which would not be good on tile or linoleum floors. Haven't figured out how to compensate for that as tennis balls are too large. I may see if I can find the rubber tip for a walking cane to see if it can be made to fit over the end. Otherwise, a good device.
customer_reviews.author: D. Turner

customer_reviews.title: but on thick pile carpet it is horrible. The wheelbase is too narrow and a heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: This device works on hardwood floors, but on thick pile carpet it is horrible. The wheelbase is too narrow and a heavy box will tip over easy while trying to turn. With 4 wheels on the ground at the same time, you cannot pivot or turn sharply with the Vevor and usually the load will tip over since the Vevor is very light. the protective plugs in the tube bottoms keep falling our. I would never buy this again, and would not recommend it to anyone with thick pile carpets.
customer_reviews.author: H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It is difficult to use..... ...
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to use............perhaps if the deck was longer. We found it difficult to tip back if the load was,even, a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: It broke on first use and damaged my floor
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept however this product is poorly made. The buttons that allow you to extend and collapse the handle jammed during the first use of the product. I was unable to collapse the handle for storage. The bottom of the cart has sharp edges which tore my tile floor and gouged the wood at the top of my stairs. Used one time and then thrown in the dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Payne

product_meta.title: VEVOR Stair Climbing Cart Portable Climbing Cart 330 lb Capacity All Terrain Stair Climbing Hand Truck Folding Stair Hand Truck Heavy Duty with 6 Wheels (Black)
product_meta.description:
Portable Stair Climbing Cart 330 lb Capacity 6 Wheeled Climb Hand Truck Dolly with Backup Wheels

Introduction

This Stair Climbing Cart combines an all-terrain three-wheel chassis with a folding hand cart. Our unique engineering means that it is just as capable of bringing home the groceries with ease at it is hauling a 330lbs. Bearings that will hold up to the rigors of modern life, and developed on a modular folding chassis that will shape itself to the unique challenges of objects in different environments and on different surfaces. Improved Stability And Balance. With four wheels in contact with the ground at all times, the weight of the load is distributed more evenly and makes it easier for you to handle.Height adjustable handle allows you to select the optimum height for both stairs and level surfaces to minimize strain and help reduce the risk of fatigue and injury.

Features

 Folded that it very convenient to carry and use. 

The wheel use the material of rubber tire and plastic steel.

Unique engineering design makes it easy to climb the stairs.

 Doubles as a carrying case for the UpCart. 

The climber makes transport and storage easy, painless, and hassle free.

Capable of bringing home the groceries with ease at it is hauling a 420 lbs.

The cart wheel is strong when the thickness of the tire jacket is 0.5" (13mm)

Could be folded to a size of just over 30 inches, allowing for convenient storage.

Technical Parameters:

Model: Climbing Folding Cart

Maximum load: 330lbs(150kg)

Overall Length: 30in(76cm)

Frame Width: 18in(46cm)

Pipe Thickness: 0.05 inch(1.2mm)

Height When folded: 30 inch (76cm)
